intro: Theobroma bernoullii subsp. capilliferum, commonly known as the pink velvet tamarind, is a species of tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers and elongated, woody pods. The plant produces edible seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in tropical climates. Theobroma bernoullii subsp. capilliferum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
